item.title: Chris add a quote by Clarence Darrow
item.description: "Every instinct that is found in any man is in all men. The strength of the emotion may not be so overpowering, the barriers against possession not so insurmountable, the urge to accomplish the desire less keen. With some, inhibitions and urges may be neutralized by other tendencies. But with every being the primal emotions are there. All men have an emotion to kill; when they strongly dislike some one they involuntarily wish he was dead. I have never killed any one, but I have read some obituary notices with great satisfaction." -- Clarence Darrow

item.title: Chris add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "When I despair, I remember that all through history the way of truth and love have always won. There have been tyrants and murderers, and for a time, they can seem invincible, but in the end, they always fall. Think of it--always." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Chris add a quote by F.E. Smith, Lord Birkenhead
Chris add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "For myself I am an optimist - it does not seem to be much use to be anything else." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Chris add a quote by Winston Churchill
item.description: "Tact is the ability to tell someone to go to hell in such a way that they look forward to the trip." -- Winston Churchill

item.title: Chris add a quote by Winston Churchill
item.description: "A lady came up to me one day and said 'Sir! You are drunk', to which I replied 'I am drunk today madam, and tomorrow I shall be sober but you will still be ugly." -- Winston Churchill

item.title: Chris add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "A fanatic is one who can't change his mind and won't change the subject." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Chris add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "When the eagles are silent, the parrots begin to jabber." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Chris add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Kites rise highest against the wind, not with it." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Chris add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "We sleep safely at night because rough men stand ready to visit violence on those who would harm us." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Chris add a quote by Winston Churchill
item.description: "The price of greatness is responsibility." -- Winston Churchill

item.title: Chris add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "From now on, ending a sentence with a preposition is something up with which I will not put." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Chris add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "In War: Resolution, In Defeat: Defiance, In Victory: Magnaminity In Peace: Good Will." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Chris add a quote by Nelson Algren
item.description: "When I burn please bury me deep Somewhere on West Division Street Put a bottle beneat' my head 'n a bottle beneat' my feet" -- Nelson Algren

item.title: Chris add a quote by Nelson Algren
item.description: "Chicago is an October sort of city even in spring." -- Nelson Algren

item.title: Chris add a quote by Nelson Algren
item.description: "Never sleep with someone whose troubles are worse than your own." -- Nelson Algren

item.title: Chris add a quote by Nelson Algren
item.description: "... Chicago divided your heart. Leaving you loving the joint for keeps. Yet knowing it never can love you." -- Nelson Algren

item.title: Chris add a quote by Nelson Algren
item.description: "Yet once you've come to be part of this particular patch, you'll never love another. Like loving a woman with a broken nose, you may well find lovelier lovelies. But never a lovely so real." -- Nelson Algren
